blocks.name: neibastop1
blocks.content: A collection of neighborhood bases determines a topology. Part of Theorem 4.5 of Stephen Willard's _General Topology_. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 8-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

thm neibastop1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c3 : c1 →(P(P(c1))\ { ∅ })))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧(s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s1 ∈(c3 ` s0)∧ s2 ∈(c3 ` s0)))→((c3 ` s0)⋂ P((s1 ⋂ s2)))≠ ∅)
  ⊣ c0 = { s3 ∈ P(c1)| ∀(s0 ∈ s3,((c3 ` s0)⋂ P(s3))≠ ∅)}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c3)
  ⊣ d(s3, c1)
  ⊣ d(s3, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
  ⊣ d(s3, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)), d(s1, s3))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)), d(s2, s3))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)), d(s1, c0))

blocks.name: neibastop2
blocks.content: In the topology generated by a neighborhood base, a set is a neighborhood of a point iff it contains a subset in the base. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 9-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm neibastop2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))

  -| wi(wa(w0, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(c4, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(c4, cv(s0))))), wne(cin(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cpw(cin(cv(s1), cv(s2)))), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c3, crab(s3, cpw(c1), wral(s0, cv(s3), wne(cin(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cpw(cv(s3))), emptycls))))

blocks.name: neibastop3
blocks.content: The topology generated by a neighborhood base is unique. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 16-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)
